title: Synthesizing Composite Hierarchical Structure from Symbolic Music Corpora
author: Ilana Shapiro (University of California, San Diego), Ruanqianqian Huang (University of California, San Diego), Zachary Novack (University of California, San Diego), Cheng-i Wang (AudioShake), Hao-Wen Dong (University of California, San Diego), Taylor Berg-Kirkpatrick (University of California, San Diego), Shlomo Dubnov (University of California, San Diego), ..., Sorin Lerner (University of California, San Diego)
relevance_why: The proposed structural temporal graph (STG) and centroid derivation method could potentially enhance understanding and generation of music structures, which is relevant to Haohe Liu's work in audio generation.
background: The study focuses on analyzing and synthesizing hierarchical musical structures from symbolic music datasets.
contribution: This paper introduces the structural temporal graph (STG) to synthesize a representative musical structure from a corpus, achieving the derivation of a centroid STG that accurately characterizes the overall structure.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods largely focus on single levels of musical hierarchy and lack integration for generating structured music from multiple pieces.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work combines comprehensive hierarchical representation with a novel measure of structural distance and centroid derivation using simulated annealing.

key_innovation: Develops a unified k-partite directed acyclic graph to encapsulate musical structures across multiple levels, facilitating enhanced music analysis and generation.
real_world_impact: The work lays a foundation for improved music generation systems, potentially aiding composers and enhancing generative AI's capacity in creative fields.
limitations: The study mentions challenges related to fully capturing rhythmic contour, which is excluded from the analysis due to a lack of accessible algorithms.

new_terms.structural temporal graph: **Structural temporal graph (STG)** is a hierarchical model representing musical structures across different levels, encoding both the structural hierarchy and temporal relationships.
new_terms.centroid STG: **Centroid STG** refers to a representative graph derived from a corpus of STGs that characterizes the overarching structure of the musical pieces.

open_sourcing: All code can be accessed in the GitHub repository: github.com/ilanashapiro/constraints
